Package edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_tasks.model.notebook

Class Notebook

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_tasks.model.notebook.Notebook
  • public class Notebook
extends java.lang.Object
    The Notebook class has a notebookName, a list of taskLists, an active task list, a current task list, and a method for adding, removing, and editing Tasks and TaskLists
    Author:
    rsthoma5

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Notebook​(java.lang.String name)
      Creates a new Notebook with the given notebookName, empty tasks and tasklists, and a true isChanged

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description

      Adds the given Task to the currentTaskList of the Notebook

      Updates the info of the Task at the given index of the currentTaskList with the given name, description, recurring status, and active status

      • Notebook

        public Notebook​(java.lang.String name)
        Creates a new Notebook with the given notebookName, empty tasks and tasklists, and a true isChanged
        Parameters:
        name - the notebookName to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given name is null or "Active Tasks"

        Returns:
        the Notebook's notebookName

      • isChanged

        public boolean isChanged()
        Gets whether or not the Notebook has been changed since its been last saved
        Returns:
        true if the notebook has been changed, false if it hasn't

      • setChanged

        public void setChanged​(boolean isChanged)
        Sets the changed status to the given boolean variable
        Parameters:
        isChanged - the changed status to set

      • addTaskList

        public void addTaskList​(TaskList taskList)
        Adds the given TaskList to the Notebook
        Parameters:
        taskList - the TaskList to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if given taskList's name already exists or is "Active Tasks"

      • getTaskListsNames

        public java.lang.String[] getTaskListsNames()
        Gets the names of all the TaskLists in the Notebook in a array
        Returns:

      • editTask

        public void editTask​(int idx,
                     java.lang.String taskName,
                     java.lang.String taskDescription,
                     boolean recurring,
                     boolean active)
        Updates the info of the Task at the given index of the currentTaskList with the given name, description, recurring status, and active status
        Parameters:
        idx - the index of the Task to change
        taskName - the taskName to give the Task
        taskDescription - the taskDescription to give the Task
        recurring - the recurring status to give the Task
        active - the active status to give the Task
